medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms of depression began approximately 2.5 years ago following coronary artery bypass graft surgery and subsequent ablation procedure for atrial fibrillation. Initial improvement with medication was noted, but depression worsened in April 2001. Symptoms included lack of energy, lack of interest in activities, social withdrawal, loss of appetite (10 lb weight loss over 6 months), and hypersomnia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery bypass graft surgery, atrial fibrillation, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, benign prostatic hyperplasia, seizure disorder (last seizure in his 30s).
medical_history.family_history: One brother with Alzheimer's disease; another brother with multiple medical problems.
medical_history.social_history: Married with three adult children and several grandchildren. Mr. S retired 10 years ago and reported not adjusting well to retirement.
